description: In the release manifest, a release manager can specify the exact composition of applications and their versions that are known to work together.
title: release manifest

___name.description: Identifier for the release. Can stay the same for multiple releases.

___version.description: The version of your release. Use [semver](http://semver.org/). This value is exposed as SYSTEM_VERSION in all your applications.

___path.description: Path where the application is located within the source

___url.description: URL for the source. For git use https://

___referenceValue.description: The specific reference to retrieve from the source. For git, this can be a commit-id, tag (tags/${tag}) or branch

___postClone.description: Script to execute after the source has been cloned.

___source.description: Default source definition for all apps in this release. Can be overwritten by each app.

___url.description: URL for the source. For git use https://
